Description: Several sacred animals; from top to bottom; a mummified hawk; the unwrapped and desiccated body of a hawk; a mummified hawk with certain human attributes; a pot for the body of a mummified waterbird; the desiccated and embalmed body of an ibis, the body twisted around itself; a mummified ibis; a tomb painting of a roast waterfowl; two wicker baskets for mummified waterfowl; the desiccated and embalmed body of a duck; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Etching
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1631)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
